TopicTitle: Missing Savefiles or "rollback" On restart - Got a workaround

Articles.Content:
PS: EDITED TOPIC; FROM "Hey Squad! Do you ever take a look in the Ps4/Xboxone threads? are you hiding from us?"

Too something more on Topic again!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Well So here it is, I found a temporary Fix for the "Saves Lost/Rollback" problem. 

Just free up some Space, by Deleting Old SaveGames & "unused" Craft-recepies, from ex. Build menu, Press Load Craft, Then just Delete some Old stuff, also seems that "XL" Ships With more parts, takes up alot more of the memory and that is uses the same memorybank as savegames. So having too many "Crafts" saved up, even if not loaded into game, they use up a huge amount of Memory.

Some has already tested this, and seems too work, So, you just need too free up some Space every now and then, Deleting old Crafts. And this might just keep ur progressing thru the game, until it can be pathced

In my Final Test, I managed too save a Whole lot of 8 x 300Parts Ships. Yeah! 8. Thats all you need too max out Your savebank ^*

Also SaveGames, With alot of flights in them, will also take up some memory. To try not having too many saves at the same time too. 

Seems they use up the same Space of memory, so one overrides the other, and visaversa.

 

For the latest News about this workaround, check out AndyChilly's Post under. I voter it up, so should be right under this OP!

 

Gl hope this helps. 

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Also Check Out Best answer Post Under!.!

 

what the heck Squad? all these problems With the broken Console Version (cant save(Xbox)/corrupt saves(ps4)).

 

Could you guys atleast give us a Word or sumthing?

 

Now it seems most in that forum want to get a refund! And wait with the Money in Our own pockets too see if this will be fixed, cuz when you dont even answer our posts, it will problably take some time before its gonna be playable again.

 

This Title should maybe be withdrawn from Xbox Store and Ps4 store. Its a borked release!  Wont be long until i ask Xbox why this is still for sale.        

 

I do get it that you are in deep excrements atm, but a Word from you would be so Nice!

1 hour ago, DaCana said:

Now it seems most in that forum want to get a refund!

 

15 minutes ago, DaCana said:

So that every console buyer will eventualy ask for a refund, should concern them!

See, when you make obviously false statements like this it's really hard to take you seriously. I've seen perhaps three people on the forum say they want refunds. Three. I've seen far more people helping each other work around whatever issues they're having, or looking for help in learning to play.

I'm sure the console versions will improve with updates, just as the PC versions have. This sort of rant is not constructive or helpful, though.

I look at these forums, and I have and will continue to raise the issues I find here with the producer, as a tester for PC (mostly Linux) that's all I can do.

KSP on PC was never a single release, it has seen many updates and will continue to do so, so there is no reason to believe that KSP on console will not see those same updates over time, and community feedback can be incorporated.

All of us on these forums are very well aware of the issues with the consoles, if we can help we'll try but it's not easy, it's a closed system with no logs and ported by a 3rd party, so anything not in the PC version is new ground to us.

So I ask you all to give Squad time to sort these issues with Flying Tiger, and I ask you @DaCana to not swear

It feels nice to breath again. I'm glad we've finally got some response.

I'm pretty sure there's no way to relay the logs to you guys or even view them myself, but I can tell you how to re-create the crash on Xbox One:

Start a game, get multiple vessels in action (as in orbit, landings, and I'm pretty sure the MPLs might be playing a part in this), make sure you've got some debris from spent fuel tanks in orbit (might play a part in this) and then time warp. "Works" for me everytime. The game will crash, you re-open it and you are then reverted to an extremely earlier state.

After that, it will continue to crash and it will always revert to the same state.

Has anyone experienced this issue WITHOUT deploying any MPLs? This might help narrow it down.
